review.des: We thought potato croquettes were overrated and bland, but still managed to enjoy scarfing them all down!  The cocktails were fun and almost well executed.  The cocktail that the menu went into such detail to describe having two maraschino cherries came out with only one, with no comment from the server that they ran out or some other reason. Seems odd to call out such details if they aren't consistent.  Yes, this is a small observation that is nearly not worth noting. The food was good, especially the mussels. I hate the adjective 'good', but that's what it was. No regrets going, but won't rush to go back. One ladies toilet for a restaurant of that size seems unusual, but I was ok waiting for 5 minutes in line during dinner, others may not be. If you haven't been, give it a shot.

This place is great. Went in date night with my wife. We ordered 5 dishes. Scallops, half chicken, arugula salad, lamb belly, and Brussels sprouts. All great, but I listed in order of our favorite. We each also had a couple cocktails. Lots of bourbon and whiskey choices. Would definitely recommend coming here. Easy street parking and got a primo Saturday reservation time earlier in the week.

Love this place! Excellent service, relaxed vibe, great food and drinks.

We visited over the weekend for a celebratory dinner and had a great time. Our waiter was top-notch, and we stayed a little late after closing to wait out bad weather (while we waited for a Lyft), and the owner could not have been more gracious.

Will definitely be visiting again!
Awesome ! If you like bourbon manhattans try their signature drink- scallops were perfect and risotto blended well with everything on the menu.

Judging from the overall Yelp rating, perhaps my dining experience was a misstep.

Our 2016 Restaurant Week selections were as followed:

My first course consisted of the yellowtail and crispy pork belly. The pork belly was slightly overdone and beyond crispy. It was crunchy and sat upon a small mound of what seemed to be mayonnaise. The yellowtail was complimented with ginger vinaigrette, pickled chilis, and flakes of salt. Although it was delightful for the most part, the salt gathered atop one piece of fish, making it overly salty.

For second course, I had long set my mind on the wagyu pastrami and ordered without hesitation. It's rather atypical to associate waygu with pastrami, since pastrami is usually made with the cheaper beef navel. I am the usual annoying person taking pictures of food before digging in. All the while I was testing different angles, the aroma from the meat was so enticing and distracting. I quickly put my phone down and took a slice at the meat. Like a steak, it was thoroughly pink on the inside with a beautiful brown, glazed crust. Can't go wrong with this selection.

With third course, I had some regrets with my Slagel Farms suckling pig. I anticipated a tender, gelatinous roasted slab of pork. Instead, it was pulled, pale pork over a lean pork tenderloin with polenta. The flavors were as bland as the presentation. Sad to say I was underwhelmed.

Last but not least, the fourth course was the coconut cheesecake mousse paired with passion fruit sorbet, caramel, and candied coconut. I am not a fan of coconut and this dessert came as a pleasant surprise. The cheesecake was very light and frothy. I wished the portion was bigger. The sorbet was much more blatant and tangy. So with that combination together, the dessert was far from sweet but still enjoyable.

review.des:
Had reservations for 2 at two on last Friday, it was nice that they allowed reservations to be made the same day, because without reservations I'm pretty sure we would not have been able to eat here!
The food was good but the flavor profiles could have varied more. most everything we ate, had the same spicy aftertaste which was fine but they could benefit from more variety. I could have done without the $8 bread on the menu (obviously I didn't order it) but it still peeves me that any restaurant would charge that.
The wine selections was perfect- for lovers of dry wine, nothing sweet here.
On another note, our waitress must have been new-ish because she was oddly awkward for the caliber of restaurant/cost of meal. Maybe she was having an off day but every time she came to the table it felt forced. She was nice enough but could use more practice.
Overall a solid meal but with some room for improvement.

This place was great. The service is fantastic...we had a show afterwards and the waiter was really helpful in making sure we left on time. All the dishes are pretty small, tapas style. For 4 people we orders 7 dishes, which was a good amount but we could have gotten a few more if we had time. Everything was good. The croquettes are amazing, crab spaghetti was so good and a perfect amount of spicy, steak was good, Alaskan halibut was ridiculously good (must order), duck fettuccine was ok. Bacon jam was also good but nothing to write home about. Can't wait to go back
